arts.ttl: Paul Kendrick's player ratings - Wigan Athletic v Reading - '...already becoming a fans favourite...'
arts.sum: Paul Kendrick runs the rule over the Wigan Athletic side that lost 2-1 at home to Reading on Saturday and delivers his report card.

arts.ttl: Wigan Athletic boss makes brutally honest 'two-games' admission
arts.sum: Shaun Maloney was quick to acknowledge his side's last two performances have epitomised Wigan Athletic to a tee.

arts.ttl: Reading boss praises 'character' as Wigan Athletic victim of late turnaround
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt praised his side's character in their 2-1 victory over Wigan Athletic. Falling behind in the second half, somewhat against the run of play, Jayden Wareham and Tyler Bindon turned the tie on its head to secure a sixth unbeaten match and keep up with the play-off challengers heading into the final 13 matches. Hunt, returning to the ground where he ended his playing career in 2018, said: "It is what the boys have been made of [character] all the time I’ve been here. We keep getting stronger through games and keep going. At half-time I said how good we had been without being ‘us.’ At times in the first half, we moved the ball really well, but we got sucked into the slow game that they wanted to play, and I didn’t like it. When we upped the tempo, we got chance after chance. It was about not getting sucked into the opposition’s way of playing. We are young so it’s easily done but it’s about staying focused on what we did. I thought we were the better side."

arts.ttl: Reading defender set to miss the remainder of the season after injury
arts.sum: Reading defender Michael Craig is likely to miss the rest of the season injured after picking up an injury. The Royals are still in touch with the play-offs after this afternoon's 2-1 comeback win at Wigan Athletic, but Craig was one of three missing from last week's stalemate with Birmingham City. Craig, a midfielder who has excelled at full-back all season, is now out for at least six to eight weeks, but could return should the Royals qualify for the end of season play-offs. "Craigy is worse than we first thought," Hunt said in Wigan. Potentially he is going to miss the rest of the season- there is no point in dressing it up. I told him to keep his focus. This can be a really battling time, out of contract, but it could be a six-to-eight-week injury. You have to keep as optimistic as you can and keep the focus.

arts.ttl: Wigan Athletic boss reacts to Reading defeat - 'We got what we deserved'
arts.sum: Shaun Maloney insisted Wigan Athletic 'got what we deserved' after play-off chasing Reading scored two goals in the final quarter to secure all three points at the Brick.

arts.ttl: Reading hit back to clinch late win at Wigan
Team news: Wigan Athletic boss names side for Reading visit
arts.sum: Wigan Athletic manager Shaun Maloney has named an unchanged side for Saturday’s visit of Reading.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Andy Yiadom makes first squad in 320 days for Wigan Athletic trip
arts.sum: Reading captain Andy Yiadom has returned to the matchday squad for the first time in 320 days at Wigan Athletic. The 33-year-old limped off during a 2-0 win over Bristol Rovers in April but has featured in the last three Under-21 fixtures, including a 3-0 defeat to West Ham on Monday. Fit enough for a place on the bench at the Brick Community Stadium, Noel Hunt has made three changes for the visit to Lancashire. Joel Pereia remains between the posts, hoping for a third clean sheet in four matches, while Michael Craig is replaced at right-back by youngster Tivonge Rushesha. Tyler Bindon and Amadou Mbengue remain the central defensive pairing and Andre Garcia keeps his place at left-back.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading aim to keep play-off push alive with Wigan Athletic test
arts.sum: Reading look to register a sixth match unbeaten and keep up their push for the play-offs at Wigan Athletic this afternoon. Three points outside the top six heading into the final 14 matches, the Royals are in touching distance. However, the Latics are three matches unbeaten themselves, winning against Huddersfield Town on Tuesday.

arts.ttl: Wigan Athletic: Our expected team v Reading!
arts.sum: Paul Kendrick runs the rule over the Wigan Athletic squad and predicts the 11 men who Shaun Maloney will select to start against Reading at the Brick Community Stadium on Saturday.
